description: This notification is sent to all managing NMS in case the time
period for sending alarm summary or heartbeat notifications
has been changed by one NMS (i.e. via NBI) or locally on
NetAct.

event.Summary: Time period for sending $v3 notifications to NMS changed to $v4

description: The object represents the NMS-specific sequence number
of the current trap which already passed the filter check
and has been forwarded at NBI.
variables.name: NSN-SNMP-NBI-COMMONFUNCTIONS-MIB::nbiSequenceId

description: This object indicates the NetAct generation time of the
notification forwarded over the northbound interface.
variables.name: NSN-SNMP-NBI-COMMONFUNCTIONS-MIB::nbiEventTime

description: It indicates the type of traps the sending period has been
changed for.
variables.name: NSN-SNMP-NBI-COMMONFUNCTIONS-MIB::nbiChangedPeriodType

description: The object is used in the 'changedPeriod' notification
indicating the new time period used by SNMP Agent for sending
either heartbeat or alarm summary notifications. In case the
value is set to 0, the sending of the related periodic
notification has been turned off.
variables.name: NSN-SNMP-NBI-COMMONFUNCTIONS-MIB::nbiSupervisionPeriod

description: This notification is forwarded periodically to all NMS allowing
the check of the NMS-NetAct communication state. Note that the
time period is the same for all managing NMS. If the period is
set to 0, the sending of heartbeat notifications is turned off.
The object represents the NMS-specific sequence number
of the current trap which already passed the filter check
and has been forwarded at NBI.
variables.name: NSN-SNMP-NBI-COMMONFUNCTIONS-MIB::nbiSequenceId

description: This object indicates the NetAct generation time of the
notification forwarded over the northbound interface.
variables.name: NSN-SNMP-NBI-COMMONFUNCTIONS-MIB::nbiEventTime

description: This notification is sent to all managing NMS:
a) in case NetAct NBI has started and successfully initialized
i.e. communication over NBI is (again) possible OR
b) in case of loss of management information and the
configurable parameter onlyFMsupported is set 'true'.
The reception of this notification should be used by each NMS
as a signal to trigger synchronization of topology data and/or
alarms.
The object represents the NMS-specific sequence number
of the current trap which already passed the filter check
and has been forwarded at NBI.
variables.name: NSN-SNMP-NBI-COMMONFUNCTIONS-MIB::nbiSequenceId

description: This object indicates the NetAct generation time of the
notification forwarded over the northbound interface.
variables.name: NSN-SNMP-NBI-COMMONFUNCTIONS-MIB::nbiEventTime

description: This notification is sent to all managing NMS in case of a
controlled NetAct NBI shut down.

event.Summary: Controlled NetAct NBI shut down notification occurred

description: The object represents the NMS-specific sequence number
of the current trap which already passed the filter check
and has been forwarded at NBI.
variables.name: NSN-SNMP-NBI-COMMONFUNCTIONS-MIB::nbiSequenceId

description: This object indicates the NetAct generation time of the
notification forwarded over the northbound interface.
variables.name: NSN-SNMP-NBI-COMMONFUNCTIONS-MIB::nbiEventTime

description: This notification is sent to all managing NMS in case of
loss of management information and the configurable
parameter onlyFMsupported is set 'false'.
The reception of this notification should be used by each NMS
as a signal to trigger synchronization of topology data or
alarms, depending of the nbiRequestedSyncType value.
The object represents the NMS-specific sequence number
of the current trap which already passed the filter check
and has been forwarded at NBI.
variables.name: NSN-SNMP-NBI-COMMONFUNCTIONS-MIB::nbiSequenceId

description: This object indicates the NetAct generation time of the
notification forwarded over the northbound interface.
variables.name: NSN-SNMP-NBI-COMMONFUNCTIONS-MIB::nbiEventTime

description: It represents the type of data synchronization indicated
in the nbiSyncRequestedNotification.
variables.name: NSN-SNMP-NBI-COMMONFUNCTIONS-MIB::nbiRequestedSyncType

description: This notification is sent after the processing of the
following NMS requests is finished:
a) getAllAlarms
b) getActiveAlarms
c) getAckAlarms
d) getClearedAlarms
e) getAlarmsByStartingTime
f) getTopologyData
g) retransmitTraps
h) acknowledgeAlarms
i) unacknowledgeAlarms
j) clearAlarms
k) commentAlarms
The object nbiNmsUser represents the identification of the
user who triggers an alarm handling request (acknowledgement
unacknowledgement, clear, comment alarms). It can be an empty
string.
The object nbiNmsName represents the identification of the
requesting NMS and allows for the correlation between this
notification and the previous NMS request.
The object nbiNmsRequestType represents the type of NMS
request which triggered the notification sequence.
The object nbiProcessingStatus represents the final
execution status of the NMS request. Possible values:
success (1), partialSuccess (2), failure (3). The value
partialSuccess max be returned in case of request types h)
i), j) or k), e.g. when some nbiAlarmId values are wrong.
The total number of notifications sent as result of the
request is represented by the object nbiNoOfResponseTraps.
The object nbiFailureReason is set only in case the
object nbiProcessingStatus has the value partialSuccess
or failure, otherwise it is an empty string.

event.Summary: Final processing status of the NMS request: $v3

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD NSN-SNMP-NBI-COMMONFUNCTIONS-MIB::nbiEndOfSequenceNotification NSN-SNMP-NBI-COMMONFUNCTIONS-MIB::nbiSequenceId i 9999 NSN-SNMP-NBI-COMMONFUNCTIONS-MIB::nbiEventTime s EXAMPLE NSN-SNMP-NBI-COMMONFUNCTIONS-MIB::nbiProcessingStatus i 1 NSN-SNMP-NBI-COMMONFUNCTIONS-MIB::nbiNmsUser s EXAMPLE NSN-SNMP-NBI-COMMONFUNCTIONS-MIB::nbiNmsName s EXAMPLE NSN-SNMP-NBI-COMMONFUNCTIONS-MIB::nbiNmsRequestType s EXAMPLE NSN-SNMP-NBI-COMMONFUNCTIONS-MIB::nbiNoOfResponseTraps i 9999 NSN-SNMP-NBI-COMMONFUNCTIONS-MIB::nbiFailureReason s EXAMPLE

description: The object represents the NMS-specific sequence number
of the current trap which already passed the filter check
and has been forwarded at NBI.
variables.name: NSN-SNMP-NBI-COMMONFUNCTIONS-MIB::nbiSequenceId

description: This object indicates the NetAct generation time of the
notification forwarded over the northbound interface.
variables.name: NSN-SNMP-NBI-COMMONFUNCTIONS-MIB::nbiEventTime

description: This information is used by SNMP Agent in the 'endOfSequence'
notification, indicating the final processing status of the NMS
request.
variables.name: NSN-SNMP-NBI-COMMONFUNCTIONS-MIB::nbiProcessingStatus

description: It provides the identification of the NMS user who triggers
an alarm handling request (acknowledgement, unacknowledgement
clear, comment alarms).
The value is empty in case of other notifications sequences
sent as response to previous NMS requests.
variables.name: NSN-SNMP-NBI-COMMONFUNCTIONS-MIB::nbiNmsUser

description: This object is used by SNMP Agent in the 'endOfSequence'
notification, indicating the unambiguous identification of
the NMS which triggered the sending of the trap sequence.
It allows for the logical correlation of the 'endOfSequence'
notification with an NMS request (which contained this
identification).
variables.name: NSN-SNMP-NBI-COMMONFUNCTIONS-MIB::nbiNmsName

description: This object is used by SNMP Agent in the 'endOfSequence'
notification, indicating the type of NMS request which
triggered the sending of the trap sequence (e.g. 'clearAlarms'
or 'getActiveAlarms').
variables.name: NSN-SNMP-NBI-COMMONFUNCTIONS-MIB::nbiNmsRequestType

description: This information is used by SNMP Agent in the 'endOfSequence'
notification, indicating the number of notification sent due
to processing of a previous NMS request. It is used for NMS
synchronization, retransmission or alarm handling requests.
variables.name: NSN-SNMP-NBI-COMMONFUNCTIONS-MIB::nbiNoOfResponseTraps

description: This object is set only in case the object nbiProcessingStatus
in the 'endOfSequence' notification has either the value
partialSuccess or failure, otherwise it is an empty string.
variables.name: NSN-SNMP-NBI-COMMONFUNCTIONS-MIB::nbiFailureReason
